heading: li'l rascals
subheading: the "millennium generation" -- kids between the ages of 2 and 18 -- has spoken: everything being equal, they'd rather read a book than sit in front of a computer. a survey conducted by the henry j. kaiser family foundation found that while 42 percent of the kids surveyed use computers, only 9 percent listed online surfing as their favorite leisure-time activity. not surprisingly, tv easily led the pack with 64 percent. reading for fun was second at 20 percent, and listening to cds or tapes finished third, with 19 percent. playing videogames drew a mere 8 percent, something that many parents might find hard to believe.
